required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multi-Center, Prospective Registry to Evaluate the Continued Safety and Performance of Clavicle Plates
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Prospective Registry to Evaluate the Continued Safety and Performance of Clavicle Plates

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the registry is to evaluate the continued safety and performance of Arthrex Clavicle Plates used to treat clavicle fractures.

detailed_description.textblock: To assess safety, device-related adverse events will be reported and evaluated over the course of the study. To evaluate the performance imaging of the target area will be evaluated at three months postoperative. Additionally, patient-reported outcomes will be evaluated at three months postoperative, 6 months postoperative, and one year postoperative using the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS), Veterans Rand 12-Item Health Survey (VR-12), and American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeons Standardized Shoulder Assessment Form (ASES).

primary_outcome.measure: To assess a change in Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) survey
primary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperatively, 3 months, 6 months and 12 months postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Patient reported pain scale 0-10 point scale (0 min,10 max)

primary_outcome.measure: To assess a change in Veterans Rand 12-Item Health Survey (VR-12)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperatively, 3 months, 6 months and 12 months postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Patient reported changes in general health and mental survey. Average score is 50 (negative answers bring scores down, positive answers bring scores up

primary_outcome.measure: To assess a change in American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeons Standardized Shoulder Assessment Form (ASES)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperatively, 3 months, 6 months and 12 months postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: ASES is a 100-point scale that consists of two dimensions: pain and activities of daily living. There is one pain scale worth 50 points and ten activities of daily living worth 50 points.

arm_group.arm_group_label: 50 subjects, male and female, at least 18 years of age
arm_group.description: 50 subjects who are candidates for surgery using the Arthrex Clavicle Plate for treatment of clavicle fractures.

intervention.description: Arthrex Clavicle Plate for treatment of clavicle fractures
intervention.arm_group_label: 50 subjects, male and female, at least 18 years of age

study_pop.textblock: Arthrex Clavicle Plates are intended to be used in the general population for clavicle fractures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. The subject requires surgery using the Arthrex Clavicle Plate for clavicle fracture.
2. The subject is 18 years of age or over.
3. The subject is not considered a vulnerable subject (i.e., child, pregnant, nursing, prisoner, or ward of the state).
4. Subject signed informed consent and is willing and able to comply with all study requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Insufficient quantity or quality of bone.
2. Blood supply limitations and previous infections, which may retard healing.
3. Foreign-body sensitivity.
4. Any active infection or blood supply limitations.
5. Conditions that tend to limit the patient's ability or willingness to restrict activities or follow directions during the healing period.
6. Subjects that are skeletally immature.

facility.name: Sierra Pacific Orthpaedic CenterMedical Group, Inc
